name: Ich
description: A common parasitic disease that causes white spots on the fish's body.

name: Fin Rot
description: A bacterial infection that causes the fins to deteriorate and fall off.

name: Dropsy
description: A bacterial infection that causes the fish to swell and develop pinecone-like scales.

name: Velvet
description: A parasitic disease that causes a yellow or brown dust-like coating on the fish's body.

name: Columnaris
description: A bacterial infection that causes white or gray patches on the fish's body.

name: Anchor Worm
description: A parasitic disease that causes a worm-like protrusion on the fish's body.

name: Swim Bladder Disease
description: A condition that affects the fish's ability to control its buoyancy, causing it to float or sink uncontrollably.

name: Mouth Fungus
description: A fungal infection that causes white or gray patches around the fish's mouth.

name: Pop Eye
description: A condition that causes one or both of the fish's eyes to bulge out of its head.

name: Hole in the Head
description: A condition that causes small holes to form on the fish's head.
